Feral/Verdant:






The small cruiser settled down into an area that was close to the start of 
the Magdefena River in  Colombia.  The main hatch barely opened due to a lack 
of energy, but being in the tropical climate seemed to be giving it more 
energy.  Probably because of the plant parts of the mutated ship and 
photosynthesis.

Feral, who seemed to gather up more courage, walked down the ramp, trying not 
to step on the small plants that were growing out of it.  He seemed to feel a 
sensation tingle all over him as the rays of sunshine hit him.  Not warmth, 
but at his best guess he was feeding on the nourishing rays of energy from 
the ball of fire called the Sun.

"Verdant, come.  Let us explore.  I have an idea for your condition.  First 
we must find a human, alive."

A snarl came from the ship and the lumbering form of the beast that was 
Verdant came down the ramp, not caring what it was smashing.  A few grunts 
escaped what could be considered his mouth.

"Yes, Verdant, it may be hard.  I'm not even sure if they came to this 
continent at this point of time.  If they didn't, we'll just go to the source 
and follow their path."

The strange looking duo continued their travels, entering a rainforest and 
finding the constant chatter of the growth irritating.
